A

Account - Class in main
Parent class allowing you to perform actions such as Creating an account, deleting an account, adding money...

Partial constructor that sets the instances of the accountName

Partial constructor that sets the instances of accountName, and accountNumber
Account(String, String, double) - Constructor for class main.Account
Sets the instances of the accountName, accountNumber, and balance of the Base Account
accountSection(Scanner, SavingsAccount, CreditAccount, ChequingAccount) - Static method in class main.Main
Method that allows the user to navigate through the account section of the program and create, delete, and view their accounts
addAccountTypes(String) - Static method in class main.Account
Adds the account type to the account
addInterest() - Method in class main.SavingsAccount
Compound interest formula A(t) = (balance)(1+(interestrate/100))^period balance Will return interest dollar amount, not applying balance We then apply the balance to the account afterwards.
addTransaction(String) - Method in class main.TransactionHistory
Adds a transaction to the history.
applyMonthlyInterest(double) - Method in class main.CreditAccount
Applies monthly interest to the current balance.

C

callMain(int, SavingsAccount, ChequingAccount, CreditAccount, Scanner) - Static method in class main.Main
Method that calls the main method and allows the user to choose an option to navigate through the program
charge(double) - Method in class main.CreditAccount
Charges an amount to the credit account, increasing the current balance.
checkAndUpdateCreditAccount() - Method in class main.CreditAccount
Checks the credit account file to determine the last update date and applies any pending monthly interest if necessary The method ensures that the account is updated for every month that has passed since the last recorded update.
checkAndUpdateSavingsAccount() - Method in class main.SavingsAccount
Updates the current savings account balance to the new savings account balance that has the applied interest rate on it.
